name: Figure with Caption
description: Structured image or diagram block with a numbered figure label, descriptive caption, and optional source attribution. Used for charts, photos, diagrams, and illustrations that require formal referencing within the document narrative.

grid.columns: 2-14 (centered, 12 of 16 columns) or 1-16 (full-bleed for hero images)
grid.margins: $spacing-07 (32px) above/below figure block, $spacing-05 (16px) between image and caption

components: Image container: constrained to max-width 100%, centered horizontally
Figure number: $label-02 in $text-03, format 'Figure N.' prefix
Optional source line: $label-01 in $text-05, italic, prefixed 'Source:'
Optional border: 1px $ui-03 around image for screenshots or low-contrast visuals
rules: Every figure MUST have a numbered label (Figure 1, Figure 2...) — sequential throughout the document
Caption goes below the image, never above — separated by $spacing-05 (16px)
Figure block uses 12 of 16 columns (centered) for standard figures; full-bleed only for hero/decorative images
Caption text uses $body-short-01 — concise and descriptive, never exceeding 3 sentences
Source attribution (when present) uses $label-01 in $text-05 italic, placed on its own line below caption
Add 1px $ui-03 border around screenshots, UI mockups, or images that lack strong edge contrast
Minimum $spacing-07 (32px) vertical clearance from surrounding body text to prevent visual collision
Figures must not break across pages — use page-break-inside: avoid on the entire figure block

printBehavior.bleedHandling: no bleed for standard figures; full-bleed optional for hero images only

accessibilityNotes: Use <figure> and <figcaption> semantic HTML — mandatory for all figure blocks
Every image must have a meaningful alt attribute — not just 'Figure 3' but a description of what is shown
Source attribution should be inside <figcaption> for programmatic association with the figure
Decorative borders ($ui-03) must have aria-hidden='true' — they are visual aids, not content
antiPatterns: Never place a figure without a caption — unlabeled images break document flow and prevent cross-referencing
Never use $heading-* tokens for captions — captions are descriptive metadata, not section headers
Never allow figures to break across page boundaries — the entire block (image + caption + source) must stay together
Never stretch low-resolution images to fill the column — maintain aspect ratio, center with whitespace instead
Never stack multiple figures consecutively without intervening narrative text — each figure needs contextual reference in the body
